intro: Colysis laciniata, commonly known as the fringed spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers that range from yellow to red, often with a distinctive fringed appearance. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Colysis laciniata is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its milky sap and diverse ecological roles.
